alert.note: Alert for Hunt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 1:00PM CST until January 25 at 1:09AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Cowleech Fork Sabine River At Greenville affecting Hunt County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan affecting Rockwall and Hunt Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Cowleech Fork Sabine River at Greenville. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Caution should be exercised near the river as water begins to flow out of the banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 14.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 13.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
